metadata.title: CVE-2024-38540 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:bnxt_re: avoid shift undefined behavior in bnxt_qplib_alloc_init_hwqUndefined behavior is triggered when bnxt_qplib_alloc_init_hwq is calledwith hwq_attr->aux_depth != 0 and hwq_attr->aux_stride == 0. In that case,"roundup_pow_of_two(hwq_attr->aux_stride)" gets called. roundup_pow_of_twois documented as undefined for 0. Fix it in the one caller that had thiscombination. The undefined behavior was detected by UBSAN: UBSAN:shift-out-of-bounds in ./include/linux/log2.h:57:13 shift exponent 64 istoo large for 64-bit type 'long unsigned int' CPU: 24 PID: 1075 Comm:(udev-worker) Not tainted 6.9.0-rc6+ #4 Hardware name: Abacus electric,s.r.o. - servis@abacus.cz Super Server/H12SSW-iN, BIOS 2.7 10/25/2023 CallTrace: <TASK> dump_stack_lvl+0x5d/0x80 ubsan_epilogue+0x5/0x30__ubsan_handle_shift_out_of_bounds.cold+0x61/0xec__roundup_pow_of_two+0x25/0x35 [bnxt_re]bnxt_qplib_alloc_init_hwq+0xa1/0x470 [bnxt_re]bnxt_qplib_create_qp+0x19e/0x840 [bnxt_re] bnxt_re_create_qp+0x9b1/0xcd0[bnxt_re] ?
